Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (15 ll. written across fibres), verso pasted down. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Copy oath made by Petearsemtheus son of Panobchunis, probably in connection with his marriage (cf. no. 10502). Date. year 20 Payni 12 (?) [of Ptol. Alexander]". "[The Group of demotic papyri no.10491-10505 were all acquired as a single lot in 1896 and form the archive of a single family in Gebelen. Some show some connection with other Gebelen papyri published by Spiegelberg in the Strassburg dem. papyri, & with some Greek ones published in P. Grenf. II. They extend from B.C. 125 to 88.] More papyri of this archive were acquired in 1899 (nos. 10510-18) and in 1901 (nos. 10521, 10533-4)".
Bibliographic references: Kaplony-Heckel 1963a / Die demotischen Tempeleide I: Text (p.291-2)
Kaplony-Heckel 1963b / Die demotischen Tempeleide II: Abbildungen (p.161)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (62) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/62)
